Entries.default: "Outsider! Unlike Burapo, I do not use this as a term of offense, I say." Tangara gives you a pleasant smile.
"Visitor. I hope your time on Ori o Koīki has been hospitable." Tangara nods.
"Farewell."
"Ruāsare! Our temple is breached!"
"Patrol, I say! Accursed rust bucket."
"What's wrong with your construct?"
"The rust bucket does not follow my instructions and ignores my command words."
"I could take a look at the construct for you."
"I am appreciating the offer, but it is better if I learn how to operate my degraded friend."
"If there is a problem with its logical reckoning, there's no danger of it misunderstanding - just failing to understand."
"I'm something of a construct expert, myself. If I got a closer look at the make of this one, I could narrow down the source of the malfunction."
Pursing his lips, Tangara looks grudgingly impressed.
"Ekera, it seems I must credit the gods for sending you to Ori o Koīki! Burapo be damned, I say."
"Never mind."
"I say there is no replacing Ruāsare. May... may Tangaloa welcome her."
"Burapo will delight the gods from between the ribs of Tangaloa, I say."
"We do not see many visitors on Ori o Koīki. Those who come... aheh, seldom leave."
"They come asking our ranga to show her belly in surrender."
"Ruāsare expects you."
"A valuable lesson about animancy, I say - there is quality and there is cheap, but never both." Tangara sighs, patting one of his pockets to the jingling of a few shells.
"I would be a poor host if the ironclad thing decided to remove your skin." He chuckles, but the humor doesn't quite reach his eyes.
"Ekera, then consider yourself free to tinker away at my rusted doll."
"I've dealt with worse. Believe me."
"A kind gesture, I say, but no."
"Ekera, I can see that well enough from here."
Raising his fingers to his lips, Tangara scrutinizes you in silence.
"Ekera, you are persistent, but I must politely refuse."
"Here, the command words. They do me little good." He passes you a tattered scroll and shrugs, smiling wanly.
"Burapo told me that your construct had fallen on hard times."
"Ekera, he talks too much."
"What are your thoughts on Burapo?"
"Ech, how he fills our home with the stink of his burnt offerings!" Tangara wrinkles his nose and waves his hand in a dispelling motion.
"Nothing is spared his flame if it appeases the gods."
"Instead she shows them their guts at the end of a spear." Tangara grins and makes a thrusting motion with both hands.
"The tribe is short a ranga and a priest, but I say the Mataru will band together."
"A rational mystic burns incense or candles, but Burapo burns koīki, rotten meat, and bundles of hair."
"Ekera, you must understand the tribe would not forgive me if you came to harm."
"You said that outsiders don't tend to leave Ori o Koīki?"
